comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content: By call nr. is close to www.loc.gov/pictures/resource/ggbain.15851/ (LC-B2-3034-11, Bain Call Number.) which has date written February 1913, during the 10 Tragic Days, the uprising previous to Madero's overthrow. The camera is heading south, by Cinco de Febrero to the corner of Dieciseis de Septiembre where the tower is seen ( today the right tower of Palacio de Gobierno del Distrito Federal). Cinco de Mayo Avenue is behind to the right of the camera. Dr. Roberto Duarte Plastic Surgeon

comment.author: 37731937@N05
comment._content: In front of National Palace. At the right hand (not shown in the photo) is the Cathedral.

comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/bert_ha_herrera] 
If the camera is facing south, National Palace should be at left (east) and the Catedral Metropolitiana behind the camera (north).
The building on the background is the old Palacio de la Municipalidad, today is where the main offices of the goverment of the Federal District operate.
Dr. Roberto Duarte 
Plastic Surgeon

comment.author: 53461717@N08
comment._content: The arcade to the right belongs to the building that during the Colony was known as Portal de Mercaderes.
